importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the culmination of a pivotal playoff series, marking the Blue Jays' long-awaited return to the World Series.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The ALCS series spanned from late September to early October 2025, culminating in a decisive Game 7 victory that brought the Blue Jays to the World Series.

keyTakeAways: George Springer hit a three-run home run in the seventh inning to give the Toronto Blue Jays a crucial lead in Game 7 of the American League Championship Series.
The Blue Jays won 4-3 over the Seattle Mariners, securing their first World Series appearance since 1993.
The game featured controversy over a groundball play where Julio Rodriguez reached base after a ricochet off Naylor's helmet, leading to a disputed call that was overturned.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP with a .385 batting average and three home runs during the series.
The Toronto Blue Jays will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, marking a historic matchup between the AL’s top team and the defending champion.
The Seattle Mariners remain the only MLB franchise never to have appeared in a World Series, highlighting the significance of their elimination.
George Springer, the 2017 World Series MVP, returned from injury to deliver a pivotal performance, emphasizing team resilience and fan support.
Chris Bassitt and Jeff Hoffman closed out the game in relief, with Hoffman pitching a perfect ninth to secure the win.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Designated hitter and key player for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer delivered a decisive three-run home run in the seventh inning, turning the tide of the ALCS Game 7 and securing the Blue Jays' World Series berth.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Toronto, Canada
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays won the ALCS, marking their first World Series appearance since 1993 and ending a 32-year drought in the postseason’s highest stage.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Seattle, United States
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners lost Game 7 of the ALCS to the Blue Jays, remaining the only MLB franchise to never have advanced to a World Series.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Los Angeles, United States
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the defending champions and will face the Blue Jays in the World Series, creating a high-stakes matchup between the top AL team and a defending champion.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Star player and key offensive contributor for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP after a stellar performance with a .385 batting average and three home runs in the series.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodriguez
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Seattle Mariners player and series MVP candidate
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rodriguez led off multiple innings with home runs and key plays, including a solo shot in the third inning that extended the Mariners' lead.

namedEntities.name: Cal Raleigh
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Seattle Mariners player and regular season home run leader
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Raleigh hit five long balls in the playoffs, including four against the Blue Jays, contributing to the Mariners’ early momentum.

namedEntities.name: Eduardo Bazardo
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Toronto Blue Jays pitcher who faced George Springer in the seventh inning
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bazardo was the pitcher in the final at-bat when Springer hit the game-winning home run.

namedEntities.name: Chris Bassitt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bassitt pitched a scoreless eighth inning, helping preserve the Blue Jays' lead in Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman pitched a perfect ninth inning to close out the game and secure the Blue Jays' victory.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Toronto Blue Jays player who tied the game in the first inning
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Varsho’s single in the bottom of the first inning tied the game at 1-1, providing early momentum for the Blue Jays.

namedEntities.name: Jorge Polanco
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Seattle Mariners player involved in a controversial groundball play
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Polanco reached base after a ricochet off Naylor’s helmet, leading to a contentious call that was reversed after review.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Toronto Blue Jays third baseman involved in the controversial groundball play
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Clement attempted a double play, but his throw ricocheted off Naylor’s helmet, allowing Polanco to reach first base.

namedEntities.name: Shane Bieber
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Seattle Mariners pitcher who faced Vladimir Guerrero Jr. in the third inning
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bieber was the pitcher who gave up a solo home run to Rodriguez in the third inning.

namedEntities.name: Rogers Centre
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Home stadium of the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The game was played at the Rogers Centre, where the crowd’s reaction to Springer’s home run and the final out reflected the emotional significance of the victory.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays clinched their first World Series berth since 1993 by defeating the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in a dramatic Game 7 of the American League Championship Series. George Springer’s three-run home run in the seventh inning, after a late-inning rally and overcoming injury, was the turning point, while Vladimir Guerrero Jr. earned ALCS MVP honors with a .385 average and three home runs. The game was marred by controversy over a groundball play involving Julio Rodriguez, Jorge Polanco, and Ernie Clement, where a ricochet off Naylor’s helmet led to a disputed call. The Blue Jays’ bullpen, led by Chris Bassitt and Jeff Hoffman, closed out the game, with Hoffman pitching a perfect ninth. The Seattle Mariners, the only MLB franchise never to reach the World Series, were eliminated. The Blue Jays will face the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, marking a historic postseason clash.
title: George Springer’s epic home run helps send the Toronto Blue Jays to the World Series with ALCS Game 7 win over Seattle
